etymology.description: 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") + 浆(漿) (jiāng, "thick liquid") = 豆浆(豆漿) (dòujiāng, "soy milk") refers to the thick liquid made from soybeans.
etymology.interpretation: This combination makes sense as 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") indicates the main ingredient, soybeans, and 浆(漿) (jiāng, "thick liquid") describes its liquid form. Together, they precisely describe soy milk, a popular beverage made by soaking and grinding soybeans.

examples.chinese: 我每天早晨都喝豆浆(我每天早晨都喝豆漿)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān zǎochén dōu hē dòujiāng.
examples.english: I drink soy milk every morning.

examples.chinese: 早餐配豆浆(早餐配豆漿)，让身体充满活力(讓身體充滿活力)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎocān pèi dòujiāng, ràng shēntǐ chōngmǎn huólì.
examples.english: Having soy milk with breakfast energizes the body.

examples.chinese: 豆浆营养丰富(豆漿營養豐富)。
examples.english: Soy milk is rich in nutrients.
